event: Earliest human ancestors inhabit parts of present-day Britain
Neolithic farming communities build monuments such as Stonehenge
Celtic cultures dominate Britain
Roman conquest of Britain begins
Hadrian’s Wall is built to mark the northern frontier of Roman rule
Roman administration withdraws from Britain
Anglo-Saxon kingdoms form across England
Viking raids begin with the attack on Lindisfarne
Wessex resists Viking conquest, preserving Anglo-Saxon rule
Norman Conquest reshapes England’s ruling class and culture
Domesday Book records land and wealth across England
Magna Carta limits royal power and establishes legal precedent
Wales is conquered and incorporated under English rule
Black Death devastates population and transforms society
Wars of the Roses erupt over control of the English crown
Tudor dynasty begins, restoring royal authority
English Reformation breaks with the Roman Catholic Church
Defeat of the Spanish Armada secures naval dominance
Union of the English and Scottish crowns under one monarch
English Civil War challenges absolute monarchy
Monarchy is abolished and a republic is proclaimed
Monarchy is restored under constitutional limits
Glorious Revolution establishes parliamentary supremacy
Acts of Union create the Kingdom of Great Britain
Industrial Revolution begins, transforming economy and society
Union with Ireland forms the United Kingdom
Britain defeats Napoleon and dominates global affairs
Slavery is abolished across the British Empire
Great Exhibition showcases industrial and imperial power
United Kingdom enters World War I
World War I ends, reshaping Britain’s global role
Irish Free State separates from the United Kingdom
United Kingdom enters World War II
Postwar Britain begins transition from empire to welfare state
Indian independence accelerates the end of the British Empire
Suez Crisis marks decline of imperial power
United Kingdom joins the European Economic Community
Devolution reshapes governance in Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland
